gloss: a belt-fed machine gun capable of firing more than 500 rounds per minute; used by United States troops in World War II and the Korean War / a high ranking police officer / a muzzle-loading high-angle gun with a short barrel that fires shells at high elevations for a short range / a portable .30 caliber automatic rifle operated by gas pressure and fed by cartridges from a magazine; used by United States troops in World War I and in World War II and in the Korean War / a woman policeman / characterized by action or forcefulness or force of personality / marked by firm determination or resolution; not shakable / mercilessness characterized by an unwillingness to relent or let up / the police sergeant on duty in a police station
United States general who was killed along with all his command by the Sioux at the Battle of Little Bighorn (1839-1876) / any animal that lives by preying on other animals

characterized by directness in manner or speech; without subtlety or evasion / inappropriate and unpleasing manner or style (especially manner or style of expression) / without tact; in a tactless manner
